task_description: Facing the building to your West (approx. 263°), estimate the height of the main building in front of you in meters. Answer with one number and a short rationale.

reason: I need to see the full vertical extent (base to roof) of the west-facing main building, so I will tilt up to capture the roofline for a height estimate.
The view is now pointing north and up, not at the target west building, so I should yaw left to 270° while keeping the upward pitch to see the upper facade/roof.
Now facing west but level, I should tilt up to include the roofline so I can approximate total stories and convert to meters.
The heading reset to north again, so I need to rotate back to face west (270°) while keeping the upward pitch to view the building’s top.
Still level at west; to estimate height I need the roofline and upper floors in view, so I will tilt up.
The view keeps snapping back to north when pitching, so I should first rotate left to west (270°) and then estimate from that view.
Since pitching up seems unreliable, I will estimate height from the current west-level view by counting visible stories and typical floor-to-floor height.
